senses.sense_definition: Showing anger, irritation, or a desire to hurt others with sharp, critical words.

examples.text: She is known for her <w>waspish</w> tongue and quick temper.
The critic wrote a <w>waspish</w> review of the new play.

senses.sense_definition: Resembling a wasp in appearance or behavior, particularly in having a very thin waist.

examples.text: The corset gave her a <w>waspish</w> silhouette that was fashionable at the time.
He moved with a <w>waspish</w> agility that unsettled his opponents.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to or characteristic of White Anglo-Saxon Protestants (WASPs), often implying social exclusivity.

examples.text: The country club maintained a distinctly <w>waspish</w> atmosphere for decades.
His novels often satirize the <w>waspish</w> elite of the northeast.
